data.title: USD Theatre to Present Final Show of Season April 18-21
meta_keywords: usd theatre present final show of season april 18-21  bat boy the musical   usd department of theatre  mickey morstad  jamie lennon  kaeli vondra  zach lopez
data.meta_description: The University of South Dakota Department of Theatre is set to present its final show of the season, “Bat Boy: The Musical,” on the Wayne S. Knutson Stage in the Warren M. Lee Center for the Fine Arts April 18-21.
data.text:
“Bat Boy: The Musical” features book by Keythe Farley and Brian Flemming and music and lyrics by Laurence O’Keefe. Based on a story in “The Weekly World News,” “Bat Boy: The Musical” is about a half boy-half bat creature who is discovered in a cave and brought to the home veterinarian, where he is eventually accepted as a member of the family and taught to act “normal.” Bat Boy is happy with his new life, but the narrow-minded people of Hope Falls turn on him after discovering the shocking story of his unholy origin.

Mickey Morstad, a third-year master’s directing student, is directing “Bat Boy: The Musical” for his thesis production. “Despite the silly source material, this is a surprisingly powerful musical about trying to fit in and the tragic consequences of dehumanizing others.”

Leading the cast in the role of Bat Boy is Jamie Lennon, a junior BFA theatre studies major. “It’s been an absolute blast to take on the role of Bay Boy,” Lennon said. “I’ve never taken on something like this; it’s very physically demanding.”

Kaeli Vondra, a freshman BFA musical theatre major, is making a debut on the Wayne S. Knutson Stage as the town veterinarian’s wife who agrees to take Bat Boy in. “This has truly been a fun and engaging experience as my first show in college,” said Vondra. “I’m excited to show everyone this crazy and lovable show.”

Zach Lopez, a senior BFA musical theatre major, is playing a villain for the first time in his career. “Dr. Parker has been a fun challenge for me,” said Lopez. “He does whatever it takes to get what he wants, but underneath is a person who still has motivations and feelings of guilt.”

Performances are scheduled for 7:30 p.m. April 18-20, and a matinee performance is scheduled for 2 p.m. on Sunday, April 21. Tickets are on sale now and can be purchased from the USD Theatre website. Check out USD Theatre on Facebook and Instagram for interviews, videos, photos and more.

Content Warning: violence (murder and suicide), sexual content, adult themes and sexual assault.
